required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PrEParing Family Planning Clinics to Streamline Integration of HIV Prevention Services for Young Women in Kenya
clinical_study.official_title: PrEParing Family Planning Clinics to Streamline Integration of HIV Prevention Services for Young Women in Kenya

collaborator.agency: Kenya National AIDS & STI Control Programme

brief_summary.textblock: This a prospective, open-label implementation project to catalyze integration of HIV prevention and PrEP care services for adolescent girls and young women in family planning clinics in Kenya.

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators will conduct a stepped-wedge cluster-randomized programmatic project to integrate PrEP provision within a combination HIV prevention package in 12 family planning clinics in Kisumu, Kenya- a region with an HIV prevalence of up to 28% among young women. The project will optimize and sustain PrEP delivery with existing family planning staff, supported through training and ongoing technical assistance. The investigators will rigorously evaluate program reach, effectiveness, adoption, implementation, maintenance, and impact using validated implementation science frameworks and how clinics build new efficient delivery systems.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This a programmatic stepped-Wedge cluster randomized trial

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women accessing family planning services who are screened for HIV risk
primary_outcome.description: Measure HIV risk screening completion among women receiving family planning services

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women accessing family planning services who uptake PrEP for HIV prevention
primary_outcome.description: Measure PrEP initiation among women receiving family planning services

secondary_outcome.measure: PrEP adherence quantified by tenofovir drug levels in blood
secondary_outcome.description: Measure PrEP adherence among women who initiate PrEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women who remain HIV-negative
secondary_outcome.description: Assess HIV status of women receiving family planning services

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of family planning clinics that implement PrEP provision
secondary_outcome.description: Measure number of clinics that provide PrEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of targeted providers who are trained and provide PrEP
secondary_outcome.description: Measure number of providers in family planning clinics who implement PrEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of core PrEP delivery components delivered per protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Measure fidelity to PrEP delivery procedures in family planning clinics

secondary_outcome.measure: Facilitators and barriers to PrEP implementation
secondary_outcome.description: Mixed methods assessment of clinic readiness and ability to implement PrEP per protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Programmatic costs of providing PrEP in family planning clinics
secondary_outcome.description: Conduct micro-costing, cost-effectiveness, and budget impact analyses to estimate the programmatic costs of providing PrEP in family planning clinics

secondary_outcome.measure: Develop data tools to expand and support delivery of family planning and HIV prevention services
secondary_outcome.description: Coordinate with key stakeholders to develop and refine data tools and clinical delivery products during project implementation

arm_group.arm_group_label: PrEP for HIV-1 uninfected for women accessing family planning
arm_group.description: Women accessing family planning will be assessed for HIV risk and PrEP eligibility. If eligible and willing to initiate PrEP, they will be provided PrEP in accordance with national guidelines as part of their standard of care at the family planning clinic.

intervention.description: A fixed-dose, oral co-formulation of emtricitabine (FTC)/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) is the approved and preferred regimen for HIV-1 prevention in Kenya and the United States. The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends TDF-containing medications as PrEP, which includes TDF combined with FTC as well as potentially TDF alone and TDF combined with lamivudine (or 3TC, a medication closely related to FTC). Any TDF-containing medications that align with WHO and Kenya national guidelines for PrEP will be used. PrEP medication will come from clinic stocks.
intervention.arm_group_label: PrEP for HIV-1 uninfected for women accessing family planning

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female of reproductive age
- Sexually active
- Able and willing to provide informed consent
- HIV negative, according to national HIV testing algorithm
- Has at least one risk factor for HIV as defined by the Kenya National AIDS and STI Control Program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Otherwise not eligible based on the above inclusion criteria

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Global Health, School of Medicine and School of Public Health,
